verses.kjv: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian band,
verses.ct: In Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in the regiment known as the Italian Regiment.

verses.kjv: A devout man, and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.
verses.ct: He was a devout man who was wholeheartedly dedicated to God, along with everyone in his household. He gave generously to people in need and constantly prayed to God.

verses.kjv: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.
verses.ct: One afternoon, around 3 o'clock, he clearly saw in a vision an angel of God approaching him and saying, "Cornelius."

verses.kjv: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.
verses.ct: He stared at the angel in fear and asked, "What is it, Lord?" The angel told him, "Your prayers and your generous giving have risen up as an offering that God remembers."

verses.kjv: And now send men to Joppa, and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter:
verses.ct: "Now send some men to Joppa and ask for a man named Simon, who is also called Peter."

verses.kjv: He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.
verses.ct: "He is staying with Simon the leather worker, whose house is right by the sea. He will tell you what you need to do."

verses.kjv: And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;
verses.ct: After the angel who spoke to him had left, Cornelius called 2 of his household servants and a devoted soldier who served him regularly.

verses.kjv: And when he had declared all these things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.
verses.ct: He explained everything that had happened to them and then sent them off to Joppa.

verses.kjv: On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:
verses.ct: The next day, as those men were traveling and getting close to the city, Peter went up on the flat roof of the house to pray around noon.

verses.kjv: And he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,
verses.ct: He became extremely hungry and wanted something to eat. But while the meal was being prepared, he fell into a trance.

verses.kjv: And saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:
verses.ct: He saw heaven opened and something like a large sheet being lowered to the earth, held by its 4 corners.

verses.kjv: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.
verses.ct: Inside it were all kinds of 4-legged animals, reptiles, and birds.

verses.kjv: And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.
verses.ct: Then a voice told him, "Get up, Peter. Kill and eat."

verses.kjv: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.
verses.ct: But Peter replied, "Absolutely not, Lord! I have never eaten anything impure or ritually unclean."

verses.kjv: And the voice spake unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.
verses.ct: The voice spoke to him a second time: "Do not call anything impure that God has made clean."

verses.kjv: This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.
verses.ct: This happened 3 times, and then the sheet was pulled back up into heaven.

verses.kjv: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Simon’s house, and stood before the gate,
verses.ct: While Peter was still puzzling over what the vision could mean, the men sent by Cornelius had found Simon's house and were standing at the gate.

verses.kjv: And called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.
verses.ct: They called out and asked if Simon, also known as Peter, was staying there.

verses.kjv: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.
verses.ct: As Peter was still thinking about the vision, the Spirit said to him, "Pay attention — 3 men are looking for you."

verses.kjv: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.
verses.ct: "Get up, go downstairs, and leave with them without any hesitation, because I am the one who sent them."

verses.kjv: Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause wherefore ye are come?
verses.ct: So Peter went down to the men and said, "I'm the person you're looking for. What brings you here?"

verses.kjv: And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.
verses.ct: They answered, "Cornelius the centurion — a good man who is wholeheartedly dedicated to God and highly respected by the entire Jewish community — was directed by a holy angel to invite you to his home so he could hear what you have to say."

verses.kjv: Then called he them in, and lodged them. And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
verses.ct: So Peter invited them in and gave them a place to stay. The next day he left with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa went along.

verses.kjv: And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea. And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.
verses.ct: The following day they arrived in Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had gathered his relatives and close friends.

verses.kjv: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
verses.ct: When Peter came in, Cornelius met him and dropped to his knees at Peter's feet to worship him.

verses.kjv: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.
verses.ct: But Peter pulled him to his feet and said, "Stand up — I'm just a human being like you."

verses.kjv: And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.
verses.ct: As Peter talked with him, they went inside, where he found a large group of people assembled.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
verses.ct: Peter said to them, "You understand that it is against Jewish law for a Jewish person to associate with or visit someone of another nationality. But God has shown me that I should never consider any person impure or unclean."

verses.kjv: Therefore came I unto you without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?
verses.ct: "That is why I came without raising any objections when you sent for me. So may I ask — why exactly did you send for me?"

verses.kjv: And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
verses.ct: Cornelius replied, "4 days ago at this very hour — around 3 in the afternoon — I was praying in my house, and suddenly a man in brilliant clothing stood in front of me."

verses.kjv: And said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.
verses.ct: "He said, 'Cornelius, God has heard your prayer, and he has taken note of your generous giving.'"

verses.kjv: Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of one Simon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.
verses.ct: "'Send to Joppa and ask for Simon, also called Peter. He is staying at the home of Simon the leather worker by the sea. When he arrives, he will speak to you.'"

verses.kjv: Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.
verses.ct: "So I sent for you right away, and it was good of you to come. Now all of us are here in God's presence, ready to hear everything the Lord has instructed you to tell us."

verses.kjv: Then Peter opened his mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:
verses.ct: Then Peter began to speak: "I now truly understand that God does not show favoritism."

verses.kjv: But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.
verses.ct: "Instead, in every nation, anyone who deeply reveres him and does what is right is acceptable to him."

verses.kjv: The word which God sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)
verses.ct: "You know the message God sent to the people of Israel, announcing the good news of peace through Jesus Christ — who is Lord of all."

verses.kjv: That word, I say, ye know, which was published throughout all Judaea, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;
verses.ct: "You know what happened throughout all of Judea, starting from Galilee after the baptism that John proclaimed."

verses.kjv: How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.
verses.ct: "You know how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, and how he went around doing good and healing everyone who was under the devil's oppression, because God was with him."

verses.kjv: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:
verses.ct: "We are witnesses of everything he did throughout the Jewish homeland and in Jerusalem. They killed him by hanging him on a wooden cross."

verses.kjv: Him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;
verses.ct: "But God raised him from the dead on the 3rd day and allowed him to be seen."

verses.kjv: Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, even to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.
verses.ct: "Not by everyone, but by witnesses God had already chosen — by us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead."

verses.kjv: And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God to be the Judge of quick and dead.
verses.ct: "He commanded us to preach to the people and to declare that he is the one God appointed as judge of the living and the dead."

verses.kjv: To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.
verses.ct: "Every prophet testifies about him — that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name."

verses.kjv: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.
verses.ct: While Peter was still saying these things, the Holy Spirit came down on everyone who was listening to the message.

verses.kjv: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: The Jewish believers who had come with Peter were amazed that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out on non-Jewish people as well.

verses.kjv: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,
verses.ct: They could hear them speaking in other languages and praising God. Then Peter responded,

verses.kjv: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?
verses.ct: "Can anyone refuse to let these people be baptized with water? They have received the Holy Spirit just as we did!"

verses.kjv: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.
verses.ct: So he ordered that they be baptized in the name of the Lord. After that, they asked him to stay with them for several days.
